summary: This is a forwarded email chain from December 2020 regarding a victim's application to the Office for Victims of Crime (OVS). The chain includes discussion about the victim's eligibility and potential treatment with a specific therapist. The email originates from a trial attorney's office in Fort Lauderdale.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Author of the original email forwarding an OVS application for a victim and mentioning the victim's intent to treat with Randee Kogan.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Copied on the original email from Brittany Henderson regarding the OVS application.

persons.name: Randee Kogan
persons.context: Mentioned as the intended therapist for the victim if the OVS application is approved.

connections.description: Henderson copies Edwards on an email regarding a victim's OVS application, indicating a professional legal collaboration.
Henderson mentions that the victim intends to treat with Kogan if the application is approved, indicating a referral or professional connection.

events.title: OVS Application Submission
events.description: Brittany Henderson submits an Office for Victims of Crime (OVS) application for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and discusses the victim's eligibility and treatment plans.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
keyFacts: An OVS (Office for Victims of Crime) application was submitted for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein in April 2020.
The application was handled by trial attorney Brittany Henderson from a law firm in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
There was internal discussion among FBI NY personnel about whether the victim was eligible for OVS, noting the victim was a victim in Florida.
If approved, the victim intended to seek treatment with therapist Randee Kogan.
The email chain was forwarded in December 2020, indicating ongoing administrative or legal follow-up regarding victim compensation.
